results.title: Madeline's winter vacation. Madeline at the ballet
results.creator_credit: DIC Entertainment, Family Channel and Stan Phillips
results.brief_description: Madeline, Pepito and the girls visit an Alpine Chalet in “Madeline’s winter vacation.” The trip is laden with adventure as they encounter the Abominable snowman, ski, skate and get caught in an avalanche. Madeline fears that because she is so small she will not be able to perform with a famed ballet master in “Madeline at the ballet.” Her insecurity impedes her success until a famous ballerina gives her a pep talk and some ballet shoes.

results.title: Madeline's rescue
results.creator_credit: Cinar Films, France Animation, Ronald A Weinberg, Christian Davin, Stephan Martiniere and Cassandra Schafhausen
results.brief_description: Based upon the ever popular books by Ludwig Bemelmans and narrated by Christopher Plummer. Madeline, merrily balancing along a bridge rail, takes a plunge into the river! But before the current can carry her away, a plucky dog paddles to her rescue. Miss Clavel and the girls adopt the dog, and soon find she is no ordinary mongrel. She helps with lessons, sings and spells, and even picks her own lovely name - Genevieve! The fun lasts until the Chairman of the trustees of Miss Clavel’s school arrives to enforce the rule: No dogs allowed! He vows the girls will never set eyes on Genevieve again. The girls, drowned in grief, search for their pet in vain. Then one day Genevieve returns. So does the Chairman of the Trustees - just in time for Genevieve to share her wonderful surprise! A song-filled story destined to enchant children of all ages.

results.title: Madeline's Christmas
results.creator_credit: Cinar, France Animation, Ronald A Weinberg and Stephen Martiniere
results.brief_description: Madeline (the mischievous little heroine with a heart twice her size) and eleven of her friends experience a snowstorm and are confined indoors. But it’s Christmas so Madeline cares and cleans for her sneezing friends with many songs and cheer, reminding us all of the true spirit of Christmas - love and friendship. Based on the popular novels by Ludwig Bemelmans and narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Madeline
results.creator_credit: Cinar Films, France Animation, Ronald A Weinberg, Christian Davin, Stephen Martiniere and Cassandra Schafhausen
results.brief_description: Her heart was big, her size was small and Madeline was loved by all. The delightful narration of Christopher Plummer brings life to the endearing character of Madeline, lovingly created by Ludwig Bemelmans. In a Parisian girls’ school, our perky, popular heroine charms even her classmates with funny pranks and youthful wit. However, when she needs her appendix removed, it is she who needs charm and humour for a speedy recovery. With cheerful music and charming characters, this beautifully animated classic will touch your heart.

results.title: Madeline
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Ludwig Bemelman and told in rhyming verse. It depicts Madeline, the smallest and most fearless of twelve girls in a Paris school, having her appendix out in a hospital full of toys, books and flowers. Music by David Raksin, animation by Bill Melendez and Frank Smith, narration by Gladys Holland. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Madeline
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Jaffilms, Saul Cooper, Pancho Kohner, Allyn Stewart and Daisy Von Scherler Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950’s, this live action film is based on plot elements found in several of Ludwig Bemelmans much loved novels about the adventures of the orphan Madeline and her friends. In this film Madeline’s French boarding school is threatened with closure when Lord Covington (Nigel Hawthorn) decides to sell the property, leaving the girls and schoolmistress Miss Clavel (Frances McDormand), homeless. The plucky Madeline takes it upon herself to save her home and that of her 11 friends, thus facilitating some interesting adventures, including falling into the Seine and being saved by a dog whom she befriends and names Genevieve. In her plot to save the school she remembers an advantageous relationship she made when she was in hospital for an appendectomy when she met Lord Covington’s dying wife. There are other forces at bay too to help Madeline, next door neighbour Pepito is creating some distracting noise pollution by whizzing around on his Vespa; deterring any interested buyers. It quickly becomes apparent that Pepito is is also in need of Madeline’s help when she discovers a plot by the circus performers, Idiots Popopov to kidnap him. With combined efforts they might be able to save the day. Cast includes Hatty Jones (Madeline), Frances McDormand, Nigel Hawthorn, Ben Daniels and Arturo Venegas.

results.title: Made in Hong Kong = Xianggang zhizao [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nicetop Independent, Team Work Production House, Andrew Lau, Doris Yang and Fruit Chan
results.brief_description: This low budget teen flick, the first independent film to emerge from the former British colony, certainly captured the critics’ praise and received several international awards for its young Chinese director, Fruit Chan. The central character, Autumn Moon (Sam Lee), who, abandoned by his father and living with his mother in the back streets of urban Hong Kong where crime, gangs and violence exist on a daily basis, operates as a small-time debt collector for Wing, his triad “big brother”. Moon is a survivor and although he acts cool and mean, can also show compassion and tenderness, particularly for the under-dog as in the case of Sylvester (Wenbers Li), a mentally handicapped friend whom he zealously protects from bullying gangs and Ping (Neiky Yim), the daughter of one of his debtors, who is suffering from a fatal kidney disease and who Moon soon finds himself falling for. A young schoolgirl’s suicide will inextricably link the lives of Moon, Sylvester and Ping taking them down a sad and tragic path of despair and violence but one begins to empathise with Moon along this journey as he tries to protect those he loves. Gritty, tender, violent, comic, “Made in Hong Kong” is film noir in style with Moon acting as narrator throughout the story but it is also expressionistic visually, using strobe, overexposure, freeze-frames, and jump-cutting, adding depth and enhancement to Chan’s debut film. Cast also includes Amy Tam, Carol Lam, Doris Chow, Wu Wai-chung. In Mandarin with English subtitles. (Awards: Locarno; Gijon; Hong Kong)
